Therefore, what better way than to further tighten this relationship in God's own country, Kerala? There are a variety of places for honeymoon in Kerala (Read More)to make your partner fall more in love with you and the relationship. With beaches that stretch forever and never-ending tea estates, heart-shaped lakes and serene backwaters, Kerala is indeed a paradise on Earth. Here is the list of 24 Honeymoon Places in Kerala For A Romantic Getaway 1. Munnar 4.2 /5 View 38+ photos Known For : Mattupetty Dam Kolukkumalai Tea Estate Rose Garden Munnar Munnar, a picturesque hill station in Kerala, is a dreamy honeymoon destination with its rolling hills, tea gardens, and misty atmosphere. Couples can enjoy scenic viewpoints like Top Station and the beauty of waterfalls like Attukad and Lakkam. The cool weather, cozy resorts, and tranquil surroundings make Munnar ideal for romance. Boating on Kundala Lake or a walk through the tea plantations adds a special touch to the experience. Best Time: September to May 54 Munnar Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Alleppey 4.8 /5 View 62+ photos Known For : Houseboats in Alleppey Alleppey Beach Ambalappuzha Sree Krishna Swamy Temple Alleppey, known as the "Venice of the East," is famous for its serene backwaters and charming houseboats. A stay on a private houseboat offers couples a unique experience, drifting along picturesque canals surrounded by lush greenery and coconut groves. Watching the sunset over Vembanad Lake is particularly romantic. The town also has beautiful beaches, making it perfect for a blend of relaxation and adventure. Best Time: June to March 39 Alleppey Attractions View Packages Read More 3. Kumarakom 4.6 /5 View 18+ photos Known For : Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary Kumarakom Backwaters Thanneermukkom Bund Kumarakom, a tranquil backwater paradise, is ideal for honeymooners seeking peace and natural beauty. Couples can take a private boat ride on Vembanad Lake and explore birdlife at the Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary. Luxury resorts with views of the lake provide romantic settings and private moments. Candlelit dinners by the water add a special element to the experience. Best Time: October - February 21 Kumarakom Attractions View Packages Read More 4. Bekal 4.2 /5 View 8+ photos Known For : Bekal Fort Bekal Beach Kappil Beach Bekal is a romantic coastal town best known for its majestic Bekal Fort and scenic beach. Couples can explore the fort for breathtaking sea views and enjoy peaceful moments on the expansive beach. Nearby luxury resorts provide intimate experiences with private pool villas and spa treatments. Bekal’s calm and secluded environment makes it a perfect spot for relaxation and romance. Best Time: October to March 12 Bekal Attractions View Packages Read More Kerala Travel Packages Compare quotes from upto 3 travel agents for free 4 Nights / 5 Days 5 Days Munnar Thekkady Alleppey Tour Package Munnar(2N) → Thekkady(1N) → Alleppey(1N) Sold By: 7c Destinations(4.9 ) ₹ 14,500 14% off ₹12,390/person Get Offers> 6 Nights / 7 Days Enchanting Kerala Getaway for 6 Nights Package Munnar(2N) → Thekkady(1N) → Kumarakom(1N) → Kovalam(2N) ₹ 32,000 13% off ₹27,825/person Get Offers> 5 Nights / 6 Days Kerala Package Itinerary with Houseboat Experience Munnar(2N) → Thekkady(1N) → Alleppey(1N) → Kochi(1N) ₹ 16,999 11% off ₹14,999/person Get Offers> 7 Nights / 8 Days Kerala & Kanyakumari Grandeur: 7N/8D Tour Munnar(2N) → Thekkady(1N) → Kochi(1N) → Kanyakumari(1N) &ra... Wayanad 4.3 /5 View 71+ photos Known For : Edakkal Caves Banasura Sagar Dam Chembra Peak Wayanad offers a romantic escape with its lush forests, misty mountains, and waterfalls. Couples can explore the scenic viewpoints of Chembra Peak, visit the peaceful Pookode Lake, and tour Edakkal Caves for a touch of history. The cool weather and abundance of nature make it perfect for cozy resorts nestled in the hills. Adventure-loving couples can enjoy trekking, wildlife spotting, and exploring tea and coffee plantations. Best Time: Throughout the year 46 Wayanad Attractions View Packages Read More 6. Thekkady 4.4 /5 View 20+ photos Known For : Periyar National Park Kadathanadan Kalari Centre Periyar Tiger Trail Thekkady, famous for its Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, offers honeymooners a mix of nature and adventure. Couples can take a romantic boat ride on Periyar Lake and watch for wildlife like elephants and deer. The scenic spice plantations and lush landscapes add a touch of charm. For adventure-loving couples, jungle safaris and treks through the forests create unforgettable memories. Best Time: Throughout the year 27 Thekkady Attractions View Packages Read More 7. Kovalam 4.6 /5 View 26+ photos Known For : Kovalam Beach Vizhinjam Lighthouse Neyyar Wildlife Sanctuary Kovalam is Kerala’s iconic beach destination, with its beautiful sandy shores and lively atmosphere. Couples can enjoy romantic beachside dinners, indulge in Ayurvedic massages, and explore nearby lighthouse viewpoints. The clear blue waters and golden sands make it perfect for sunset walks. Kovalam also offers water sports for adventurous couples, adding excitement to a honeymoon. Best Time: September to March 33 Kovalam Attractions View Packages Read More 8. Varkala 4.5 /5 View 23+ photos Known For : Varkala Cliff Janardhanaswamy Temple Varkala Beach Varkala, with its stunning cliffs overlooking the Arabian Sea, is a unique beach destination in Kerala. Couples can enjoy the pristine beaches, take part in yoga sessions, and relax at cliffside cafes with incredible views. Varkala’s tranquil beaches and vibrant sunsets create a romantic atmosphere. The nearby mineral springs are believed to have healing properties, making it a refreshing spot for honeymooners. Best Time: October to February 31 Varkala Attractions View Packages Read More 9. Devikulam 4.5 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Devi Lake Pallivasal Falls Thoovanam Falls Devikulam, a charming hill station near Munnar, is an ideal honeymoon spot with its mist-covered mountains and pristine lakes. The highlight here is the picturesque Sita Devi Lake, where couples can enjoy a quiet picnic or take in the breathtaking views. Surrounded by lush tea plantations, Devikulam offers a serene environment and cooler climate, making it perfect for romantic getaways. The area also boasts waterfalls and scenic trails, providing ample opportunities for nature walks and quiet moments together. Best Time: November to May 4 Devikulam Attractions Read More 10. Idukki 4.0 /5 View 39+ photos Known For : Hill View Park Idukki Arch Dam Kalvari Mount Idukki is a haven for nature lovers with its rich forests, wildlife sanctuaries, and scenic landscapes. Couples can visit the Idukki Arch Dam, enjoy panoramic views from Calvary Mount, and explore tea and spice plantations. The cool weather and lush greenery add a serene charm to the experience. Idukki’s hilltop resorts and secluded spots make it ideal for a romantic getaway. Best Time: Throughout the year 40 Idukki Attractions View Packages Read More 11. Thrissur 4.0 /5 View 44+ photos Known For : Sree Vadakkumnathan Temple Paramekavu Bhagavathy Temple Thiruvambady SreeKrishna Temple Thrissur, known as the cultural capital of Kerala, offers a blend of history, art, and natural beauty. Couples can explore the town’s famous temples, attend cultural performances, and visit the nearby Athirappilly Waterfalls. Thrissur also offers vibrant festivals like Thrissur Pooram, adding a touch of Kerala’s culture to the experience. The town's unique blend of heritage and scenic surroundings makes it a charming honeymoon spot. Best Time: October - February; April, May 50 Thrissur Attractions View Packages Read More 12. Vagamon 4.7 /5 View 21+ photos Known For : Vagamon Falls Kurisumala Vagamon Lake Vagamon, a serene hill station, is known for its lush meadows, pine forests, and peaceful ambiance. Couples can enjoy paragliding together, explore the Vagamon Pine Forest, and relax by the beautiful waterfalls. The misty valleys and cool weather create an intimate setting for romance. Vagamon’s secluded spots and quaint cottages provide a sense of privacy and charm. Best Time: October - March 20 Vagamon Attractions View Packages Read More 13. Poovar 4.3 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Poovar Beach Poovar Backwater Cruise Vizhinjam Poovar Island is a serene getaway located near the southern tip of Kerala, known for its golden sand beaches and peaceful backwaters. Couples can stay at luxurious floating cottages and take romantic boat rides through scenic canals. The unique location where the river meets the sea creates beautiful landscapes. Poovar’s secluded atmosphere makes it perfect for a private and relaxing honeymoon. Best Time: August to March 13 Poovar Attractions View Packages Read More 14. Kollam 4.4 /5 View 43+ photos Known For : Thangassery Lighthouse Kollam Beach Jatayu Earth's Centre Kollam, with its backwaters and beaches, offers honeymooners a mix of tranquility and natural beauty. Couples can enjoy houseboat cruises on Ashtamudi Lake, visit scenic beaches, and explore the beautiful Thangassery Lighthouse. The town also has historical sites like the Kollam Port and charming coastal landscapes. Kollam’s relaxed vibe and scenic spots create a romantic escape. Best Time: September to February 40 Kollam Attractions View Packages Read More 15. Vythiri 4.1 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Pookot Lake Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary BeeCraft Honey Museum Vythiri, nestled in the lush Wayanad district, is a romantic escape known for its dense forests, coffee plantations, and stunning waterfalls. Honeymooners can stay in unique treehouse accommodations that blend into the natural surroundings, offering privacy and a touch of adventure. The scenic Pookode Lake, nearby waterfalls, and serene viewpoints make Vythiri perfect for couples seeking a mix of relaxation and exploration. The area is also rich in wildlife, and a walk through its forests or a visit to Wayanad’s nature reserves adds to the romance. Best Time: October to Apr 10 Vythiri Attractions Read More 16. Ponmudi 4.3 /5 View 13+ photos Known For : Peppara Wildlife Sanctuary Golden Valley Mini Zoo, Ponmudi Ponmudi is a peaceful hill station that promises couples a secluded and romantic atmosphere. Known for its winding trails, tea estates, and misty hills, Ponmudi offers honeymooners scenic views and cool, refreshing weather. Couples can hike to viewpoints, explore small waterfalls, and enjoy the unique golden-hued grasslands that add to the area’s beauty. Its proximity to Trivandrum makes Ponmudi an accessible escape, offering cozy resorts and cottages ideal for a relaxing honeymoon retreat. Best Time: November to May 5 Ponmudi Attractions Read More 17. Kalpetta 4.3 /5 View 23+ photos Known For : Karapuzha Dam Kanthanpara Waterfalls Shopping in Kalpetta Kalpetta, also located in Wayanad, is surrounded by lush greenery, hills, and serene lakes, making it a perfect honeymoon destination. Couples can explore nearby attractions like the beautiful Banasura Sagar Dam, Edakkal Caves, and Soochipara Waterfalls. With its tea and coffee plantations, Kalpetta offers a relaxed and scenic environment for quiet, intimate moments. The town has charming resorts set in nature, making it easy for honeymooners to unwind and soak in Wayanad’s beauty. Best Time: October to March 20 Kalpetta Attractions View Packages Read More 18. Kumily 4.4 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Periyar National Park Trekking Abraham's Spice Garden Kumily is a charming town near Thekkady, known for its proximity to Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary and scenic spice plantations. Honeymooners can enjoy romantic boat rides on Periyar Lake, explore the lush spice gardens, and take part in guided jungle walks or safaris. The town’s spice-scented air and beautiful natural setting make it a unique and memorable destination. With cozy resorts and homestays offering a mix of luxury and traditional Kerala hospitality, Kumily provides a romantic escape into Kerala’s wild side. Best Time: September to Apr 5 Kumily Attractions Read More 19. Athirapally Falls, Thrissur 4.2 /5 Athirappilly, known as the “Niagara of India,” is famous for its grand waterfall and scenic surroundings. Couples can enjoy a picnic by the waterfall, explore the lush forests, and capture the scenic beauty of this natural wonder. The misty atmosphere and thundering sound of the falls create a mesmerizing ambiance. Resorts near the falls offer cozy stays with incredible views. Read More 20. Kuttanad, Alleppey 4.7 /5 Kuttanad, known as the “Rice Bowl of Kerala,” offers unique backwater experiences with its paddy fields and serene canals. Couples can enjoy boat rides through narrow waterways lined with lush greenery and coconut groves. The quaint villages and peaceful environment make it ideal for a relaxed honeymoon. Staying in a houseboat allows couples to enjoy the charm of rural Kerala. Read More 21. Marari Beach, Alleppey 4.2 /5 Marari Beach is a quiet, beautiful beach known for its golden sands and relaxed atmosphere. Couples can unwind on the beach, indulge in local seafood, and stay at beachside resorts that offer privacy and comfort. The area is less crowded, providing a perfect setting for romantic strolls. Marari is known for its eco-friendly resorts, which enhance the serene ambiance. Read More 22. Fort Kochi 4.6 /5 View 5+ photos Fort Kochi is a historic coastal town known for its blend of colonial charm and vibrant culture. Couples can wander through the quaint streets, admire the beautiful Portuguese architecture, and relax at cozy cafes. Watching the sunset at the iconic Chinese fishing nets is a romantic experience. Fort Kochi’s art galleries, unique shops, and lively culture add a special charm. Read More 23. Nelliyampathy, Kerala 4.3 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Nelliyampathy Hills Parambikulam Wildlife Sanctuary Seetharkund Waterfalls Nelliyampathy is a hidden gem with lush green hills, tea gardens, and scenic viewpoints. Couples can explore coffee plantations, visit the beautiful Seetharkundu viewpoint, and enjoy treks through the forests. The cool climate and peaceful surroundings create a perfect ambiance for romance. Nelliyampathy is known for its eco-friendly resorts, providing a quiet and relaxing retreat. Best Time: October to March 14 Nelliyampathy Attractions Read More 24. Kappad Beach, Kozhikode 4.1 /5 View 12+ photos Kappad Beach, known as the place where Vasco da Gama landed in 1498, is a beautiful spot with golden sands and historical significance. Couples can relax on the beach, enjoy the sunset, and take part in water sports. The peaceful and uncrowded atmosphere makes it a perfect location for a romantic evening. Kappad Beach offers a mix of history and natural beauty, ideal for a memorable honeymoon. Read More Enjoy your post-wedding bliss with your soulmate in Kerala while losing yourself in its beauty. Right from the beaches to heart-shaped lakes, there are multiple honeymoon places in Kerala to visit, just like in the movies! The State provides you with much-needed peace of mind you both require from the wedding humdrum you go through. This post was published by Shreya Krishnan Share this post on social media Facebook Twitter FAQs on Honeymoon Places in Kerala For A Romantic Getaway Which place is better for honeymoon in Kerala? Munnar, Alleppey, Kovalam, Thekkady, Kochi, Bekal, Kumarakom, Mattupetty Dam, Kundala Lake, Top Station, Echo Point, Tea Museum, Attukad Waterfalls, Marayoor Sandalwood Forests, Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary, You will never be short of romantic Honeymoon Places in Kerala. Which is the romantic place in Kerala? Munnar. Munnar is one of the best honeymoon destinations in Kerala due to its stunning natural beauty and sprawling hills and valleys. Is Kerala good for honeymoon? Kerala has a diverse geography and a plethora of incredible honeymoon destinations to offer. From authentic ayurvedic experiences to laid-back houseboat rides to cruises in Cochin and wildlife in Thekkady, God's own country is a fantastic place to begin your married life.
